meanings.definition: The currency of Finland before the adoption of the euro.
meanings.sent1: In the past, people in Finland used markkas to buy things.
meanings.sent2: I found some old coins that were markkas from Finland.
meanings.sent3: Grandpa joked that he still had a stash of markkas hidden under his mattress.
meanings.sent4: The memories of using markkas for transactions flooded back when I saw the old currency.
meanings.sent5: The colorful markkas had intricate designs that fascinated me as a child.

meanings.sent1: The shopkeeper counted the markkas carefully before giving change.
meanings.sent2: I need to exchange my euros for markkas before my trip to Finland.
meanings.sent3: The jar was filled with shiny markkas, making it look like a treasure chest.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the markkas clinking together was music to my ears.
meanings.sent5: The pile of markkas on the table gleamed under the sunlight.
